business.headline: Tesla drops 'coming soon' teaser on new X account ahead of India launchTesla is set to open its first Indian showroom in Mumbai's Bandra Kurla Complex on July 15. The Tesla India X account shared a "coming soon" post on Friday night.

Elon Musk's Tesla likely to begin first deliveries in India from August: ReportThis move comes at a key moment for Tesla. The carmaker has seen sales dip in other countries and is now turning to India, the world's third-largest car market, to reach new buyers.

Zerodha's Nithin Kamath hits back at 'dark patterns' used by financial appsNithin Kamath says these tricks are designed to push people into taking actions that are not in their best interest, just so companies can make more money.
Sensex ends 690 points lower, Nifty settles below 25,200; TCS falls 4%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 689.81 points to end at 82,500.47, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 205.40 points to close at 25,149.85.

New banks coming soon? India eyes first permits since 2014, says reportThe government and central bank are said to be considering multiple steps to create more, larger and stronger banks that can support India's ambitious economic growth plans over the coming decades.

Got Rs 5 lakh health insurance? Should you buy a top-up or higher sum insuredWhen you file a claim, your base policy settles the expenses first. If the bill crosses that limit, the top-up steps in. Normally, your base plan pays up to its maximum, and then the top-up kicks in to handle the rest.
Sensex plunges 700 points: Why the stock market fell 1% today? The S&P BSE Sensex fell nearly 700 points to 82,509.59, while the NSE Nifty50 declined by nearly 200 points to 25,162.25 as of 12:21 pm.

ITR-2 and ITR-3 excel utilities released: Who can file and what's new?ITR-2 is meant for individuals or Hindu Undivided Families (HUFs) who are not eligible to file ITR-1 (Sahaj). This form is meant for taxpayers who do not have any income from business or profession and do not earn any income like interest, salary, bonus, commission, etc.

Bitcoin breaks $117,000 mark, reaches all-time highAt the time of writing at 11.00 am, the world's largest cryptocurrency is trading at $117,863.18, climbing by 6.13% over the last 24 hours. Crypto experts believe if the supportive policies continue, digital coins could see even more new money coming in.

Tesla drives into India: Mumbai to get first experience centre on July 15The space will allow visitors to explore Tesla's electric cars and related technologies, though test drives and deliveries may not be offered at this stage.

TCS falls 2% on Q1 results miss. Should you buy as IT stocks struggle?TCS share price: The IT giant has lost 2.74% over the past five days and declined 4.37% in the past month. Over a six-month period, the stock is down 22.63%.

Explained: Why HUL shares rose 4% todayHUL shares were up 3.8%, trading at Rs 2,500 as of 9;25 am, compared to Thursday's closing price of Rs 2,409.05. The stock ended Thursday's session nearly 1% lower but has gained 3.58% in the past five days.
Sensex opens 280 points lower, Nifty below 25,300; HUL up 4%The S&P BSE Sensex was down 250.37 points to 82,939.91, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 64.95 points to 25,290.30 as of 9:32 am.

Stock market opening: Weak TCS Q1 results to hamper Sensex, Nifty?The Gift Nifty futures were trading at 25,295 as of 8:30 am, suggesting that the Nifty 50 could open below Thursday's closing mark of 25,355.25.
Who is Priya Nair, first woman CEO of Hindustan UnileverPriya Nair will take over from Rohit Jawa, who will step down on July 31, 2025. Nair's appointment will come into effect from August 1, 2025.

IMF praises UPI, says it makes India global leader in fast paymentUnified Payments Interface is an instant and real-time payment system developed by NPCI to facilitate inter-bank transactions through mobile phones.
Sensex closes 346 points lower, Nifty below 25,400; Airtel down 3%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 345.80 points to end at 83,190.28, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 120.85 points to close at 25,355.25.

Dubai dreams under scanner as ED questions homebuyers: ReportMany of the individuals who bought property in Dubai are now under scrutiny as they failed to provide proper bank transaction records showing how the payments were made.

8th Pay Commission may hike salaries by 30–34%: ReportThe 8th Pay Commission could benefit around 11 million people, including about 4.4 million central government employees and nearly 6.8 million pensioners. Once approved, the changes will raise their basic pay, allowances, and retirement benefits.

Will ITR filing deadline be extended again? Here's why it mightIn May, the CBDT announced extending the ITR filing deadline, citing big changes in the forms and system readiness. It said that the updated ITRs will make compliance simpler and reporting more transparent for taxpayers.

Zepto, Blinkit, Instamart face a new rival in Delhi's 10-min delivery warThe move brings the e-commerce giant into direct competition with local players such as Blinkit (owned by Eternal), Swiggy Instamart and Zepto, who already dominate the quick delivery space.

Smartworks Coworking Spaces IPO open for bidding: Should you subscribe?The bidding window for the IPO will remain open until Monday, July 14. Investors can place bids within the price band of Rs 387 to Rs 407 per share.

When nursery fees need an EMI: CoinSwitch co-founder flags new middle-class crisisOnce believed to be the key to a better life, schooling today has ironically become the heaviest expense for India's middle-class families, who are struggling to keep up, says Ashish Singhal, co-founder of CoinSwitch.

Nvidia now worth nearly as much as India's economy. Details hereAccording to the International Monetary Fund (IMF), India's gross domestic product is currently estimated at $4.2 trillion and is expected to touch $4.27 trillion by the end of 2025.

3 key reasons behind Bitcoin's record high todayAt the time of writing, Bitcoin is trading at $111,019.74, rising by 2.27% over the past day. The last record was set on May 22 when it briefly touched $111,970. Since then, Bitcoin has had a bumpy ride, but it seems to be back with a bang.

TCS to announce Q1 results today: Here's what to expect from the IT giantTCS Q1 results: Apart from growth numbers, the market will also watch for any announcements on interim dividends, updates on client budgets in sectors like banking, retail, and manufacturing, and comments on the pace of new deal wins.
Sensex opens 85 points higher, Nifty above 25,400; Tata Steel up 1%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 43.60 points to 83,492.48, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 15.90 points to 25,460.20 as of 9:28 am.

Bitcoin rockets to a record high, just shy of $112,000. Here's whyAs Bitcoin's market cap has crossed into the trillions, more institutional investors are entering the space. Large firms that once stayed away are now taking positions in digital assets, helping push prices higher.

Travel Food Services allotment: Step-by-step to check allotment statusInvestors can check their allotment status either through the BSE website or the registrar's platform, MUFG Intime India Private Limited (Link Intime India Pvt Ltd).

Nvidia makes history, becomes first company to hit $4 trillion in market valueNvidia's market cap now exceeds the combined value of the Canadian and Mexican stock markets. It is also larger than the total market capitalisation of all publicly listed companies in the UK, according to LSEG data.

Emirates signs deal to accept crypto payments for flight bookings: ReportIn recent years, the UAE has grown into a popular place for crypto companies. Many crypto firms have opened offices there or are planning to expand. Today, people in the UAE can already use cryptocurrencies to pay for things like real estate, school fees and even transport services.
Sensex closes 176 points lower, Nifty below 25,500; HCLTech down 2%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 176.43 points to 83,536.08, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 46.40 points to 25,476.10 as of 3:47 pm.

Reliance Jio IPO hits pause button, 2025 listing unlikely: ReportReliance Industries shares fell sharply after the news and were down 1.8% in afternoon trade, dragging the broader market into negative territory.

Sebi's ban on Jane Street: Could it rattle Dalal Street?While the ban is focused on a single player, many believe it may have wider effects on liquidity, trading volumes, investor confidence, and even foreign investor behaviour.

71% Indians fear AI scams during Prime Day: ReportPrime Day scams India, AI shopping scams 2025, McAfee Prime Day scam report, Fake Amazon websites India, online shopping scam awareness, AI scam protection tips, Prime Day fake deals warning, Indians fear online scams, cyber fraud Prime Day India, deepfake scams online shopping

Travel Food Services IPO to close soon: Should you subscribe? Check latest GMPThe bidding for the IPO began on July 7 and is set to close soon. Travel Food Services has set the price band for the issue between Rs 1,045 and Rs 1,100 per share.

ITR filing: Who qualifies for zero income tax?In her 2025 Budget speech, Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman shared big news. Under the new regime, if you earn up to Rs 12 lakh, you will not have to pay any income tax. Salaried taxpayers get an extra benefit too.

Infosys, TCS, Wipro: Will top IT companies gain momentum in Q1FY26?Equirus Securities, in its earnings preview, signals a subdued performance for the sector, where even the heavyweights are struggling to regain momentum.

Mutual fund inflows rise 24% in June to Rs 23,587 crore: AMFI dataAmong the 11 equity mutual fund categories, all except equity-linked savings schemes (ELSS) recorded positive inflows. Flexi cap funds emerged as the most preferred option for investors, bringing in Rs 5,733 crore in June.

9 countries where Indians can get citizenship for less than Rs 1 croreAcross many countries, it is now fully legal to buy citizenship. With a single payment or donation, Indians can get a fresh passport that offers visa-free access and minimal global taxes.

entertainment.headline: Janhvi Kapoor-Shikhar Pahariya serve style at Wimbledon 2025Janhvi Kapoor attended the Wimbledon 2025 semi-final in London with her boyfriend Shikhar Pahariya, drawing attention for their stylish presence. Several videos and images of the duo have surfaced online.

Anurag Kashyap says Siddhant Chaturvedi's comment changed Ananya PandayAnurag Kashyap praised Ananya Panday's growth as an actor, highlighting her maturity and risk-taking in career choices despite being a 'nepo baby'.

Shiva Rajkumar: Beyond bloodline, a powerhouse who redefined Kannada cinemaAt 63, with almost four decades of stardom behind him and no signs of slowing down, Kannada superstar Shiva Rajkumar stands as the powerhouse of the Kannada film industry. But what about him attracts such devotion and respect?

Coco Jones and Donovan Mitchell announce engagement after secret romance Grammy winner Coco Jones and NBA star Donovan Mitchell announced their engagement after two years of dating, sharing a romantic video and photo while opening up about their formerly private relationship.

Paul McCartney announces 2025 'Got Back' tour with 19 North American datesPaul McCartney's 2025 Got Back Tour spans 19 North American cities, starting September 29. Presale access begins July 15. Major stops include Las Vegas, Nashville, Montreal, and Chicago.

Julian McMahon's cause of death confirmed as metastatic cancerJulian McMahon, known for Nip/Tuck and Charmed, died at 56 from metastatic cancer. Co-stars Alyssa Milano and Ioan Gruffudd paid tribute to his talent, warmth, and enduring presence.
Top films and shows to watch on JioHotstar this weekendFrom documentaries and suspense thrillers to reality series, here's what you can watch on JioHotstar this weekend.

Director James Gunn calls Govinda's Superman meme the bestAhead of 'Superman's India release, James Gunn shared a special message for Indian fans and laughed over Govinda's viral Superman meme from 'Dariya Dil', calling it "the best." The video, also featuring stars David Corenswet and Rachel Brosnahan, invited Indian audiences to catch the film in theatres.

Top films and shows to watch on Prime Video this weekendPrime Video's new weekend lineup offers a diverse mix of genres, from gripping documentaries and thrilling suspense to action-packed dramas and quirky horror comedies. Indian viewers can enjoy top picks like 'Zero Se Restart,' 'Ballard,' and 'Karate Kid: Legends' for an entertaining and relaxed weekend.

Karan Johar breaks silence on Dhadak 2 delay, praises censor board's sensitivity'Dhadak 2' explores caste-based injustice with a commitment to meaningful storytelling by Dharma Productions. The film's complex certification process highlights collaboration with the CBFC for sensitive content.

Sanjay Dutt on Leo: Loved working with Thalapathy Vijay but Lokesh wasted meAs Sanjay Dutt continues his pan-India journey with back-to-back big-ticket films, the actor recently voiced his disappointment over his limited role in Thalapathy Vijay-starrer 'Leo'.

Does James Gunn's Superman make a subtle commentary on Israel-Ghaza war: ExplainedActor David Corenswet's sci-fi action-drama 'Superman' (2025) has sparked online debate over its subtle commentary on the Israel-Ghaza war. Despite director James Gunn refraining from any kind of direct political messaging, audiences have their own interpretations of the movie.

Why did Salman Khan choose Chitrangda Singh for Battle of Galwan? She answersChitrangda Singh joins Salman Khan in 'Battle of Galwan', a war drama based on the 2020 Galwan Valley clash, directed by Apoorva Lakhia. She calls it a special project, especially because of her army background and a long-awaited collaboration with Salman.

BTS' V shares Paris pics, fans wonder if he's in Seoul or Los AngelesBTS member V's whereabouts spark fan frenzy, with speculation rife over whether he's in Los Angeles, Seoul, or Paris. Here's what we know.

Pooja Hegde steals the show as Monica in Rajinikanth's Coolie second songRajinikanth's 'Coolie' latest song 'Monica' featuring Pooja Hegde delivers a vibrant dance performance. The energetic track, backed by Anirudh Ravichander's beats and a star-studded cast, promises a grand release on August 14, 2025.

Maalik review: Rajkummar Rao enjoys the gritty role, sadly, audiences don'tRelease Date:Fri Jul 11, 2025Maalik movie review: The film showcases Rajkummar Rao's gritty portrayal of an underworld don in the 80s Prayagraj. Despite strong performances, the film struggles with clichéd storytelling and emotional disconnect.

F1, Jurassic Park prove fans pay for premium entertainment despite high ticket ratesThe recent success of Hollywood films like 'Jurassic World' and 'F1' in India shows that audiences are willing to pay higher ticket prices for a premium cinematic experience despite previous concerns about affordability. Industry experts believe that strong content and immersive formats are reviving theatre business.

Son of Sardaar 2 trailer reaction: Ajay trolls Pakistan, sparks mixed fan buzzThe trailer of Ajay Devgn and Mrunal Thakur-starrer 'Son of Sardaar 2' was unveiled today. The film also stars Ravi Kishan, Sanjay Mishra, Neeru Bajwa and Chunky Panday.

general news.headline: 'I didn't cut off fuel': Cockpit exchange of Air India pilots before crashAs per the report, one of the pilots aboard the ill-fated Air India Boeing 787 that crashed in Ahmedabad on June 12 asked, "Why did you cutoff the fuel?" The other pilot responded, "I did not do so."

Both fuel switches cut off within a gap of a second: Air India crash reportIndia's Aircraft Accident Investigation Bureau found both engines of the Air India Boeing 787-8 shut down within a second of each other just after take-off in Ahmedabad, leading to the crash. The cockpit voice recorder revealed pilot confusion over the cutoffs, while RAT deployment and early altitude loss were confirmed.

The 98-second life of doomed Air India flightThe flight took off at 1:38 pm after receiving take-off clearance. The flight was just 32 seconds in the air, before it eventually crashed, according to the Aircraft Accident Investigation Bureau's 15-page preliminary probe report.

'Earned in lakhs': Cops doubt father of tennis player's taunt claim over her incomeUnconvinced by the theory, the police pointed out that Deepak's monthly income was in lakhs. 'So why would anyone taunt him like that?', a police source told India Today TV, adding that Deepak would get angry over small matters.

Wimbledon: Once time-proof, Novak Djokovic finally looked mortalWimbledon 2025: For nearly two decades, Novak Djokovic defied time with grit and brilliance. But on Centre Court, against a rising Jannik Sinner, he looked powerless to stop the clock. The warrior who once bent eras to his will finally appeared mortal.

What Air India said after crash probe report reveals fuel switches cut offAir India expressed solidarity with victims of the AI171 crash, pledged full support to affected families, and affirmed cooperation with regulators following the preliminary AAIB investigation report released on July 12.

What DY Chandrachud flagged about poll panel in One Nation, One Election billFormer Chief Justice DY Chandrachud suggested that the draft bill on One Nation One Election could benefit from minor amendments to address interpretational issues related to emergency provisions and the Election Commission's powers, sources said.

Four-storey building collapses in Delhi, several trapped under debris, 8 rescuedA four-storey building collapsed in Delhi's Seelampur area around 7 am, trapping several people; rescue ops are ongoing with six feared trapped and four rescued so far.

Floating hotels, silk trails and jungle safaris: India's cruise storyCruises - both domestic and international - are emerging as the next big travel trend in India. A new travel trend report by SOTC and Thomas Cook notes that Indians are increasingly opting for new and unique travel formats, with cruises topping the list.

Continue to support investigation: Boeing's 1st statement on Air India crash reportBoeing expressed condolences and pledged full support to the AAIB investigation into the Air India Flight 171 crash, which killed 260 people. The preliminary report revealed both engines shut down seconds after take-off.

Sachin Tendulkar relishes his spot in a Federer-Borg Grand Slam sandwichSachin Tendulkar stole the spotlight at Wimbledon by posing between Roger Federer and Bjorn Borg, calling it a "Grand Slam sandwich" — a legendary crossover moment between cricket and tennis that fans won't forget.

No Aadhaar, voter ID in Bihar poll roll revision? Why top court voiced concernThe Supreme Court has raised questions about the Election Commission's requirement for multiple documents in Bihar's voter roll revision. The move risks disenfranchising migrants and vulnerable groups, raising fears of a de facto NRC.

Janhvi Kapoor-Shikhar Pahariya serve style at Wimbledon 2025Janhvi Kapoor attended the Wimbledon 2025 semi-final in London with her boyfriend Shikhar Pahariya, drawing attention for their stylish presence. Several videos and images of the duo have surfaced online.

ED files chargesheet against MLA Rohit Pawar in Maharashtra Co-op Bank caseThe Enforcement Directorate (ED) has filed a supplementary chargesheet against NCP (Sharad Pawar faction) MLA Rohit Pawar in the Maharashtra State Cooperative Bank (MSCB) scam case, months after attaching Rs 50 crore worth of assets belonging to Baramati Agro.

Bumrah refrains from commenting on Dukes ball: My match fee will get deductedIndia fast bowler Jasprit Bumrah refrained from commenting on the Dukes ball controversy during Day 2 of the third Test against England at Lord's. Captain Shubman Gill had a heated argument with the on-field umpire over the condition of the changed ball in the first session.

Tesla drops 'coming soon' teaser on new X account ahead of India launchTesla is set to open its first Indian showroom in Mumbai's Bandra Kurla Complex on July 15. The Tesla India X account shared a "coming soon" post on Friday night.

Why is the Election Commission interfering in the election process?The Election Commission, the guardian of fairness, is stooping to their statutory duty. It's shocking to see a constitutional authority interfering in the democratic process. Next, they'll tell us elections should be won by clean, spotless politicians without spending beyond the statutory limit.
Question Time: Weekly News QuizThink you read the headlines this week? Let's test that!

Video: Newly-married couple tied to yoke like oxen, forced to plough fieldThe Odisha couple recently got married, going against community norms as the man is said to be the son of the woman's paternal aunt, a relationship considered taboo under the village's traditional customs.

Kash Patel may quit as FBI head if deputy exits over Epstein files clash: ReportFBI Director Kash Patel is reportedly considering resigning amid frustrations over Attorney General Pam Bondi's handling of the Epstein files, especially if Deputy Director Dan Bongino follows through on quitting.

Cricket may have given Karun Nair a second chance, but his time is running outKarun Nair's return to the Indian cricket team seemed like an inspirational non-fiction novel for the ages. But his time in England seems to be a horror story at the moment and the time is running out for the 33-year-old.

Shiva Rajkumar: Beyond bloodline, a powerhouse who redefined Kannada cinemaAt 63, with almost four decades of stardom behind him and no signs of slowing down, Kannada superstar Shiva Rajkumar stands as the powerhouse of the Kannada film industry. But what about him attracts such devotion and respect?

After row, Prada to team up with Indian artisans for Kolhapuri-inspired footwearOn Friday, the Maharashtra Chamber of Commerce, Industries and Agriculture (MACCI) said that they had a virtual meeting with global fashion house Prada over collaboration and ethical sourcing.

India successfully test fires 'Astra' air-to-air missile with over 100 km rangeDRDO and IAF successfully flight-tested 'Astra' missile with an indigenous RF seeker, scoring precise hits on aerial targets from a Su-30 Mk-I fighter jet. The test marks a major leap in India's indigenous missile capability.

Raveena Tandon marks son Ranbir's 18th with sweet, rare throwback momentsRaveena Tandon celebrated her son Ranbir Thadani's 18th birthday on July 12 with the sweetest Instagram post. The post featured a series of heartfelt throwback pictures of the mother-son duo.

Janhvi Kapoor-Shikhar Pahariya serve style at Wimbledon 2025Janhvi Kapoor attended the Wimbledon 2025 semi-final in London with her boyfriend Shikhar Pahariya, drawing attention for their stylish presence. Several videos and images of the duo have surfaced online.

Anurag Kashyap says Siddhant Chaturvedi's comment changed Ananya PandayAnurag Kashyap praised Ananya Panday's growth as an actor, highlighting her maturity and risk-taking in career choices despite being a 'nepo baby'.

Coco Jones and Donovan Mitchell announce engagement after secret romance Grammy winner Coco Jones and NBA star Donovan Mitchell announced their engagement after two years of dating, sharing a romantic video and photo while opening up about their formerly private relationship.

Joe Root on sleepless night of 99* in Lord's Test: Went through every shotENG vs IND: Joe Root spent a restless night on 99*, replaying every shot and possible dismissal in his head. By morning, he had sealed his 37th Test hundred — but the nerves never truly left him.

Swiatek vs Anisimova: All you need to know about Wimbledon finalWimbledon 2025: Iga Swiatek and Amanda Anisimova will be up against each other on Centre Court in the grand finale of the women's singles on Saturday, July 12 at the All England Club.

Tank half empty, heart still full: Djokovic eyes 2026 Wimbledon returnWimbledon 2025: Novak Djokovic opened up on whether he plans to return to the All England Club next year. On Thursday, Djokovic's journey this season ended after Jannik Sinner beat him in straight sets.

Asian Champion Avinash Sable fails to finish race at Monaco Diamond LeagueAsian Champion Avinash Sable suffered an unfortunate fall, which forced him not to finish his race at the Steeplechase event at the Monaco Diamond League on Friday, July 11.

Animesh Kujur misses podium at Monaco Diamond League by a whiskerAnimesh Kujur narrowly missed the podium in the Monaco Diamond League 200m final. Kujur finished just 0.13 seconds behind South Africa's Jack Naeem.

160 pounds for 75 overs? Fans slam Lord's Test for slow over-rateDay 2 of the Lord's Test match saw fewer overs bowled than expected, frustrating the fans, who paid an exorbitant amount of money to visit the stadium. The slow over-rate sparked widespread criticism and calls for better play management.

Fans slam Lord's Test for slow over-rateDay 2 of the Lord's Test match saw fewer overs bowled than expected, frustrating the fans, who paid an exorbitant amount of money to visit the stadium. The slow over-rate sparked widespread criticism and calls for better play management.

Djokovic runs out of fuel as Sinner sets up final vs AlcarazWimbledon 2025: World No.1 Jannik Sinner set up a clash with Carlos Alcaraz in the grand finale after beating 24-time major champion Novak Djokovic in straight sets in the second semi-final.

Lord's Test: KL Rahul fuels India's fight after Bumrah makes it to honours boardIndia finished day 2 of the third Test against England on 145/3, trailing the hosts by 242 runs in the first innings. Jasprit Bumrah starred for India with his 15th five-wicket haul while KL Rahul held fort with his brilliant half-century at the end of the day's play.

Shubman Gill breaks Virat Kohli's record but falls for 16 in Lord's TestShubman Gill broke another Virat Kohli record but he fell for just 16 runs on Day two of the Lord's Test on Friday, July 11. Gill went past the 600-run mark in the series and is closing in on an all-time record.

Italy qualify for T20 World Cup 2026, set to be hosted in India and Sri LankaThe Italian cricket team made it to their first-ever ICC event as they qualify for the T20 World Cup 2026, set to be hosted by India and Sri Lanka.

Root breaks Rahul Dravid's record, registers most catches by fielder in TestsStar England batter Joe Root broke Rahul Dravid's record for most catches by a fielder in Test history with a sensational grab on Day 2 of the third Test against India at Lord's.

Carlos Alcaraz keeps three-peat dream alive, storms into finalWimbledon 2025: Five-time Grand Slam champion Carlos Alcaraz marched into the men's singles final at the All England Club after beating the USA's Taylor Fritz 6-4, 5-7, 6-3, 7-6 (8-6) in the semi-final on Centre Court.

Indian Super League put on hold, 2025-26 season in doubtThe Indian Super League (ISL) has been put on hold, the Football Sports Development Limited (FSDL) told the clubs and the All India Football Federation (AIFF) on Friday, July 11.

Neeraj Chopra working on new technique for bigger throwsDouble Olympic medallist Neeraj Chopra is working to perfect his new technique under coach Jan Zelezny. He aims to improve consistency to throw bigger distances.

Root breaks Rahul Dravid's record, registers most catches by fielder in TestsStar England batter Joe Root broke Rahul Dravid's record for most catches by a fielder in Test history with a sensational grab on Day 2 of the third Test against India at Lord's.

Indian Super League put on hold, 2025-26 season in doubtThe Indian Super League (ISL) has been put on hold, the Football Sports Development Limited (FSDL) told the clubs and the All India Football Federation (AIFF) on Friday, July 11.

Neeraj Chopra working on new technique for bigger throwsDouble Olympic medallist Neeraj Chopra is working to perfect his new technique under coach Jan Zelezny. He aims to improve consistency to throw bigger distances.

Rishabh Pant braves nasty injury, takes part in training at Lord's on Day 2India vice-captain Rishabh Pant fought through the pain to take part in a batting nets session during Day 2 of the ongoing Lord's Test on Friday, July 11. Pant injured his left index finger during Day 1 of the match.

Mohammed Siraj's heartfelt tribute to Diogo Jota in Lord's Test: WatchMohammed Siraj honoured Liverpool footballer Diogo Jota with a unique celebration during the Lord's Test. Jota's sudden death in a car crash has deeply affected the sporting community around the world.

Dukes have a problem: Stuart Broad slams ball manufacturers after Lord's Test fiascoFormer England pacer Stuart Broad slammed the quality of the Dukes ball after it had to be changed after just 10.4 overs during the Lord's Test. The Dukes ball has courted controversy during the series as Indian team hasn't been happy with it.

Bumrah breaks Kapil Dev's record, registers most away 5-wicket hauls for IndiaFast bowler Jasprit Bumrah broke Kapil Dev's record as he registered the most five-wicket hauls away from home for India, with his marvellous bowling spell on Day 2 of the third Test at Lord's.

Neeraj reacts to Radhika Yadav murder: Families should support female athletesIndia's Javelin throw star Neeraj Chopra has reacted to the murder of Tennis player Radhika Yadav, who was shot dead by his father as he was enraged by her social media reels.

Semi-finals Highlights: Sinner beats Djokovic to set up final with AlcarazWimbledon semi-finals Highlights: Jannik Sinner has stormed into the final at All England Club after beating Novak Djokovic in straight sets. Earlier in the day, Carlos Alcaraz beat Taylor Fritz in four sets on Centre Court on Friday.

Gill, Siraj left fuming at umpires after ball change in Lord's TestShubman Gill and Mohammed Siraj were left fuming at the umpires after the second ball was changed after just 10.4 overs. Gill was unhappy with the replacement ball that was taken by the umpires on day two.

Rishabh Pant vs Dhruv Jurel: Karthik explains difference in wicketkeepersENG vs IND: Former Indian cricketer Dinesh Karthik analysed the wicketkeeping of Dhruv Jurel and Rishabh Pant on a similar delivery during Day 1 of the third Test against England.

Dhruv Jurel continues as keeper on Day 2, Pant still recoveringIndia vice-captain Rishabh Pant suffered a finger injury on Day 1 of the Lord's Test, prompting Dhruv Jurel to take over wicketkeeping duties on Day 2 against England, as confirmed by the BCCI.

Lord's turns red on Day 2 to support Strauss Foundation and raise fundsLord's - the Home of Cricket - once again turned red for the Ruth Strauss Foundation's annual #RedforRuth day, held on the second day of the third Test between India and England.

Lord's Test: With 37th century, Joe Root goes past Rahul Dravid and breaks into top 5Joe Root cracked into the top 5 list for the most Test hundreds with his 37th century against India on Day two of the match in Lord's. Root played 192 balls to get to his hundred.

Starc wary of pink ball challenge ahead of day-night Test in West IndiesAustralian pacer Mitchell Starc acknowledged that bowlers might receive some assistance under lights with the pink ball. Starc will complete his 100th Test at Sabina Park against the West Indies.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
